channel.title: IF Answers - Recent questions tagged tads

item.title: Can I supply my own CSS to the gs.tads.io server / interpreter?
item.description:
Now that I know that I can straight up send the gs.tads.io server my games, can I change the output in any way, or am I stuck with it's fonts, colors, etc.?

Thanks!

item.title: Is there a Javascript Interpreter for TADS that I can run on my website?
item.description: I have a website, and I want people to be able to play my adventure from my webpage. Is there source code available for a javascript TADS that I could run on my website? I know IFDB has a "play online" web interpreter, but idk what it is / where it is / how I would use it with my website

item.title: TADS3 - How to suppress output
item.description: So I've migrated to TADS, and I seem to have a lot of flexibility and everything is wonderful. The trouble is, I can't seem to find the equivalent of Inform7's "Reject the player's command;" in TADS3. How can I suppress arbitrary outputs?

item.title: Can I export / translate an adventure written with I7 to TADS?
item.description: I wrote the first half of a game in Inform 7, but I've learned about TADS which I like so much so much so much more (I got to compile my own interpreter!). Is there a way to convert the logic of I7 "code" to the C-like TADS format? I presume that the parsing stage for either is probably quite different, but I6 looks kindof similar... Perhaps compiling I7 down to I6 or something. IDK.
